abstract: The government plan to auction off the warrants it received from banks in exchange for injected funds is sensible, but the Treasury will probably be criticized anyway, Breakingviews.com says.
snippet: The government plan to auction off the warrants it received from banks in exchange for injected funds is sensible, but the Treasury will probably be criticized anyway, Breakingviews.com says.
lead_paragraph: So far, the United States has negotiated privately to sell back to banks the warrants it received in exchange for injected funds. Now it is starting an auction process to bring in a market price for a handful of companies’ warrants, including JPMorgan Chase’s. It’s sensible, but the Treasury will probably still be criticized, Breakingviews.com says.

abstract: Several U.S. policy makers consider JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, as a potential successor to U.S. Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner, The New York Post reported.
snippet: Several U.S. policy makers consider JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, as a potential successor to U.S. Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner, The New York Post reported.
lead_paragraph: Several United States policy makers consider JPMorgan Chase‘s chief executive, Jamie Dimon, as a potential successor to Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner, The New York Post reported, citing sources.

headline.main: Dimon Seen as Successor to Geithner, Report Says

abstract: Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, will lead the bank’s efforts in China.
snippet: Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, will lead the bank’s efforts in China.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase has hired Zili Shao, the head of the Asia practice at the law firm Linklaters and a major deal-maker, to lead its own efforts in China.

headline.main: JPMorgan Hires Lawyer as New China Head

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
